trans-unit.source: Represents the exception that is thrown when the view state cannot be loaded or validated.
This class cannot be inherited.

If an exception occurs when the page loads the view-state information, the page creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException> object and passes it as an inner exception within an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception is re-thrown to be handled by the application.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException> class stores information about the exception in the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Message%2A> property.

If the request has permission to access the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property, then the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Message%2A> property contains the values returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.RemoteAddress%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.RemotePort%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.UserAgent%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.PersistedState%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Referer%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Path%2A> properties; otherwise, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Message%2A> property contains a generic view-state error message.
A view-state exception can be the result of a Message Authentication Codes (MAC) validation error.
If the page attribute `enableViewStateMac` is set to `true`, view-state information is encoded with a MAC identifier.
When the view-state information is posted back to the server, the page verifies the encoding to ensure that it has not been altered by the user.

If the page cannot validate the MAC encoding on the view-state information, it will throw an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException> object as an inner exception.
For MAC validation to succeed, the view-state information must be hashed by the same key when it is sent and received.
Within a Web farm, the machine key on each server should be set to a common key.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ViewStateException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ViewStateException"></xref> class with serialized data.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Gets a value indicating whether the client is currently connected to the server.
This property returns the same value as calling the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse.IsClientConnected%2A> property.
`true` if the client is still connected to the server; otherwise, `false`.
Gets debugging information about the HTTP request that resulted in a view-state exception.
If the request does not have permission to access the server variables, then this property returns a generic view-state error message.

If the request does have permission to access server variables, the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Message%2A> property contains the values returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.RemoteAddress%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.RemotePort%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.UserAgent%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.PersistedState%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Referer%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Path%2A> properties.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the formatted message with information about the exception.
Gets the path of the HTTP request that resulted in a view-state exception.
This property returns the same value as the `PATH_INFO` variable in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property.
It returns the portion of the path after the host name.
For example, in the URL http://www.contoso.com/virdir/page.html, <xref:System.Web.UI.ViewStateException.Path%2A> would return /virdir/page.html.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the path from the request.
Gets the contents of the view-state string that, when read, caused the view-state exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the view-state values that caused the view-state exception.
Gets the URL of the page that linked to the page where the view-state exception occurred.
This property returns the same value as the `HTTP_REFERER` variable in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property.
The value is an empty string ("") if no previous request linked to the page.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the HTTP referrer.
Gets the IP address of the HTTP request that resulted in a view-state exception.
This property returns the same value as the `REMOTE_ADDR` variable in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the remote IP address of the client.
Gets the port number of the HTTP request that resulted in a view-state exception.
This property returns the same value as the `REMOTE_PORT` variable in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the remote port number.
Gets the browser type of the HTTP request that resulted in a view-state exception.
This property returns the same value as the `HTTP_USER_AGENT` variable in the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ServerVariables%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the user agent, which is typically the browser type.
